content.description:
An adventure climb by Canyon standards. One move down low off a movable-but-not-going-anywhere chockstone. Top section protected by 3 permadraws all in good shape. Right below the first one is a nice ledge to lie down on.

 About 4 feet right of the permadraw, sitting on the ledge, is a large orange pancake death block. Don't grab it to get onto the ledge. If you do, it will fall down and kill your belayer. Then it will hunt down and kill all your previous belayers for good measure. To avoid this, traverse towards the permadraw from below a bit before getting up on ledge. Sorry for spray, but better than death. I grabbed the block and felt it seriously rattle.

 The anchors are a 1 closed 1 open shut that are quite rusty. Rather than lower off them, we left 2 nice neutrino biners up there. Cleaning draws on rappel would be a pain. Please leave them so you don't screw the next adventurous soul.
content.protection: bolts and 3 permadraws to rusty cold and open shut. Permas looks pretty new as of 2020.
content.location: Very long route to the right of Lithium. Look for the 3 large, sharp, detached (but bomber) flakes 20 feet up.

content.description: Head up and right to a good jug in the roof. Put the lip and get side pull jugs to recover before the first crux. Get a leg bar at the break, and then figure out the second crux above on some small crimps.
content.location: Just to the left of Solitary Confinement in the left side of the main Crazy House Cave. Starts to the left of a cut down tree.

content.description: Big moves on good holds leads to a hard tension move to a pair of pockets just below the second bolt. Clip the bolt and grab a rest on the rail, then pull through the jugs to a high foot and a shallow undercling. Get it all back and enjoy the fun 5.10 jug hauling to the top.
content.location: First route to the left of the impossible project.

content.description: Climb a few easy overhanging moves to a fun long slab climb. End on the quicklink two bolts from the top.
content.location: The only slab route a The Crazy House

content.description: Easy 5.7 slab climbing get steep and hard fast. A stopper move at the end with a potential slab fall.
Climb classic LRC blocky terrain up and left.  Past a hand jam, boulder problem crux move and on to the anchors.
content.location: Just to the right of Bitless.

content.description: Climb a short crimpy blocky face to a roof.  Climb the roof.  Kick a heel.  Pull up.  Enjoy.
content.location: Blocky face capped by large roof.

content.description: Starting in the rear/corner between Scorpion and Asylum. This is the first route that exits the roof/cave. You pull though the roof on good holds. You’ll get a decent rest after clearing the lip and you’ll need it for the boulder problem guarding the anchors. 4 bolts. A Crazy House Classic.
content.location: Starts deep in the corner of the low roof-cave between Scorpion and Asylum. Scramble up to the small ledge where you’ll start the climb from.

content.description: Work your way up sidepull jugs to a sequential boulder problem on flat edges, pockets, pinches, and sidepulls. Get it back in the standing no hands rest, pull the juggy roof, and then navigate a final boulder problem before the chains.
content.protection: 7 bolts + anchors. Use a draw with a longer dogbone or an alpine draw for bolt three to avoid loading the carabiner in an unsafe way.
content.location: Right of Bitless. Look for the right facing side pull jugs.

content.description: Scramble to the left edge of the large, crumbling ledge on the right side of the Crazy House amphitheater.  Climb a boulder problem out the flat roof; then climb jugs to the top.
content.protection: Six bolts and an anchor. Stick Clip.

content.description: Start on the sand ledge on the bolt line left of Asylum. Climb to a butt crack feature passing the second bolt, figure out a big move to a jug and then romp to the top through easier climbing.
content.location: Starts off a sandy ledge on the right side of the amphitheater. Be care accessing the ledge, as many blocks are detached and loose.

content.description: Climb the steep overhang in the heart of the cave. Traverse right over waterfall on pocket and snag a rest before big moves at the crux. The grade on this one may vary depending on your height.
Start behind the twisted cedar tree and trend up and right on big holds, pull small roofs to anchors.
content.location: Starts behind the convoluted (twisted) cedar, to the left of Bitless and Lithium

content.description: Ultra classic. Technical moves on flat edges down low lead to a big move. The route trends right before heading back left and up to the anchors.
content.location: Look for brown rock with flat edges down low. The route climbs through a small roof down low and trends to the left of a larger one up high.

content.description: Start on ledge, slopers up to jugs in roof, a couple moves to big moves to more jugs. Knee bars and a hand jam or two up bulges then jugs to ledge and anchors.
This is the second part of the Tourist Wall that you will encounter when using the Rocktoberfest/Crazy House descent.
